search_results.snippet: The six noble gases that occur naturally are helium (He), neon (Ne), argon (Ar), krypton (Kr), xenon (Xe), and the radioactive radon (Rn). Ununoctium (Uuo) is predicted to be a noble gas as well, but its chemistry has not yet been investigated.

search_results.snippet: The six noble gases are helium (He), neon (Ne), argon (Ar), krypton (Kr), xenon (Xe), and radon (Rn). Their atomic numbers are, respectively, 2, 10, 18, 36, 54, and 86. Several characteristics, aside from their placement on the periodic table, define the noble gases.
